League 1
OM-Lille: which channel and what time?
Olympique de Marseille welcome Lille for one of the shocks of the championship, this Saturday, November 2, 2019. A meeting broadcast live on television. On which channel and at what time? Answer in this article.
02 Nov 2019, 07:00 by Florian Sermaise



OM: the 5 possible eleven for Villas-BoasDiscover 5 possible team compositions for the Olympique de Marseille this season Icon Sport

OM: the 5 possible eleven for Villas-Boas




Olympique de Marseille continues its infernal schedule. After Paris Saint-Germain a week ago, after AS Monaco a few days ago in the Coupe de la Ligue, and before Olympique Lyonnais in seven days, the Phoenicians have an appointment at the Stade VÃ©lodrome with Lille. A tour of the cadors of the championship that started badly at the Parc des Princes, the men of AndrÃ© Villas-Boas being swept by Kylian MbappÃ© and his family (0-4). The out-of-category PSG, OM has especially the opportunity against the Northerners to stick to the pursuers. Large winner of Bordeaux during the previous day (3-0), LOSC, third, actually only two points ahead of his host, currently seventh in Ligue 1. This 12th episode of the 2019/2020 season could prove to be a turning point for both teams, as regards one of the shocks of the French championship.








OM-Lille on television




Jose Fonte + 6 ğŸ“·Credit Photo - Icon Sport

This meeting of the 12th day of Ligue 1 between Olympique Marseille and Lille is to be followed live on French television this Saturday, November 2, 2019, from 17:30 on Canal +.
